activities:
When ObjectRocket is a data controller:
 
ObjectRocket collects personal information about: (i) visitors to, or users of, its websites; (ii) prospective and current customers; (iii) users of any mobile-device applications that it offers; (iv) service providers and business partners; (v) job applicants; and (vi) other third-parties that ObjectRocket interacts with.

ObjectRocket uses this information to: (i) provide services to its customers (these purposes may include any of the following: process service requests, contract negotiation, handle orders, deliver services, process payments, communicate with customers about orders, services, promotional offers and marketing to such businesses, providing customer support, manage customer relationship, developing and improving the services, fraud detection and prevention, compliance with governmental, legislative and regulatory bodies ,and to investigate complaints about the use of its services); (ii) contact individuals or companies about ObjectRocket services, employment opportunities, and potential business transactions, and to generally improve the way it markets its services; (iii) manage relations with its vendors and service provides; (iv) carry out financial and other business operations; (v) and to perform its own human resources functions. 

When ObjectRocket is a data processor: 
ObjectRocket affiliates located in the European Union and Switzerland provide ObjectRocket with personal information about their prospective and current customers, service providers, business partners, job applicants, employees, and other third parties they interact with.

ObjectRocket uses this information to assist its affiliates in providing services to their customers or for other business operational purposes.

When using ObjectRocket information technology hosting, cloud computing, and related services, ObjectRocket customers and customers of its affiliates located in the European Union or Switzerland may process personal data controlled by them (“Customer Data”). 

ObjectRocket does not determine the types of data its customers store on its servers, or transmit using its services, and/or how Customer Data is classified, accessed, exchanged or otherwise processed. ObjectRocket customers are responsible for compliance with applicable data protection principles. ObjectRocket provides its services at the direction of its customers and defines its obligations with respect to Customer Data in its agreements with its customers.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech:
European Union data protection authorities (EU DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)for employee personal information.  

We use BBB EU Safe Harbor as our independent recourse mechanism for unresolved complaints. Please see http://www.bbb.org/us/safe-harbor-complaints.
